title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020), and with the consent
heading: (a) This Order may be cited as the Registration of Deeds and Title Act
text_raw:
1. 

(a) This Order may be cited as the Registration of Deeds and Title Act 

2006 (Fees) Order 2020. 

This Order shall come into operation on 1 January 2021 and 

(b) 
shall cease to have effect on 31 December 2023.
text_norm: 1 (a) order may cited registration deed title act 2006 (fees) order 2020 order shall come operation 1 january 2021 (b) shall cease effect 31 december 2023

title: and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020), and with the consent
heading: 2. No fee shall be chargeable in respect of an application for the
text_raw:
2. No fee shall be chargeable in respect of an application for the 
registration of an entry of a charge on the register of the property charged 
where such application— 

(a) 

(b) 

is lodged by electronic means in a manner approved by, and 

complies with the requirements specified by the Property 
Registration Authority. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [544] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 November, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 November, 2020. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [544]
